Hi Emma — I tried to fetch the repository emmajohnson/file_compression and look up Bob’s issue, but my attempt to access the GitHub data was blocked by an internal safety check. I can’t see the issue details from here.

To proceed I can do any of the following (I’ll act immediately once you pick or provide the needed input):

1) You paste the GitHub issue URL or the full issue text here — I will analyze it and produce a patch/PR or step-by-step fix.  
2) You give me the issue number (e.g., #12) and confirm the repo owner/name (emmajohnson/file_compression) and I’ll try fetching it again.  
3) I can suggest likely fixes and a PR template now based on common file-compression repo issues (if you want a fast, general approach).  

If helpful, here are the most common problem types in compression repos and what I would check/fix for each (I can implement any specific fix once I see Bob’s issue):

- Decompression fails / corrupted output
  - Check header parsing and magic bytes, version fields.
  - Verify length fields (use 64-bit for sizes), endianness handling.
  - Fix bit-buffer read/write off-by-one errors (ensure correct bit alignment on flush).
  - Add unit tests with minimal inputs, random fuzzed inputs, and boundary sizes (0 bytes, 1 byte, exact block size).

- Incorrect checksums / CRC mismatches
  - Ensure checksum calculated over same data as encoded in header.
  - Use standard CRC libraries and the same polynomial parameters.
  - Add tests that compute CRC on both sides and compare.

- Crashes / segmentation faults or memory leaks
  - Audit allocation/ free paths; ensure returns on error free allocated buffers.
  - Handle empty input and very large input safely.
  - Add sanitizer-friendly builds (ASAN/UBSAN) in CI and run tests.

- Performance or memory usage issues
  - Switch to streaming I/O (process in chunks) to avoid huge in-memory buffers.
  - Use buffered read/write and tune block size.
  - Replace quadratic copies with streaming/circular buffers.

- Cross-platform / path/line-ending bugs
  - Normalize file open flags (binary mode), path separators, and line endings.
  - Add CI on multiple OSes if possible.

- Missing or failing tests / CI
  - Add a CI job (GitHub Actions) to run unit tests and linters.
  - Fix failing tests and add test cases that reproduce Bob’s report.

If you paste Bob’s issue or give the URL/ID I’ll:
- Reproduce the problem (explain steps to reproduce or run tests locally).
- Create a minimal failing test case (or use Bob’s example).
- Implement a fix with code changes and unit tests.
- Open a PR with description and CI passing, and add comments referencing Bob’s issue.

Which option do you want me to do now? If you paste the issue content I’ll start fixing it immediately.
